text: I was honoured to give a talk in Prof. Tolga Birdal’s CIRCLE Group at Imperial College London.

I have begun a 3-month appointment as a visiting researcher at Imperial College London, under the supervision of Prof. Tolga Birdal. This visit aims to advance the development of Quantum Computer Vision, with a particular focus on its applications in Machine Learning.
Our paper “QuCOOP: A Versatile Framework for Solving Composite and Binary-Parametrised Problems on Quantum Annealers” got accepted as a highlight at CVPR 2025.
I was honoured to give a talk titled “Quantum Binary Optimization” at the ECCV 2024 workshop on Quantum Computer Vision and Machine Learning (QCVML).

I started as a PostDoc at the University of Siegen in the Computer Vision Group led by Prof. Dr. Michael Möller, and I am co-supervised by Dr. Vladislav Golyanik at the Max Planck Institute for Informatics.
I successfully defended my PhD dissertation titled “Quantum Algorithms for Binary Problems with Applications to Image Processing”.
I gave a talk titled “Quantum Computing for Binary Optimization and Beyond: Bridging Classical and Quantum Landscapes” to the Computer Vision Group of the University of Siegen.
Our paper “A universal quantum algorithm for weighted maximum cut and Ising problems” got accepted for publication in Springer Quantum Information Processing.
Our paper “An Iterative Quantum Approach for Transformation Estimation from Point Sets” got accepted at CVPR 2022.
I started as a PhD student at the University of Lübeck in the Institute of Mathematics and Image Computing.

links.label: Institute of Mathematics and Image Computing
